name: Commoner
description: A Commoner is an unassuming humanoid, typically a farmer, laborer, or craftsman, wearing simple clothes. They possess no combat training and have average abilities across all attributes.
memorable: Despite their lack of power, they can form an Angry Mob that becomes surprisingly effective through numbers.
goals: Commoners generally focus on surviving and maintaining their communities, often providing vital roles in support of adventurers.
relations: Commoners can be encountered with other commoners and serve as civilians in a fantasy setting.
environment: Typically found in villages or rural areas within fantasy worlds.
strengths: They can coordinate with others to create chaotic group assaults through their Angry Mob ability.
weaknesses: Very low hit points and AC make them highly vulnerable to combat threats.
attacks: Basic melee attack with a club or a ranged stone throw, both dealing minimal bludgeoning damage.
most_powerful_ability: Angry Mob - Allows commoners to rally together to attack a single target, increasing damage based on additional participants.
senses: The Commoner has passive Perception of 10, reflecting average awareness.
skills: Skills are lackluster with +0 modifiers, indicating no particular excelling area.
additional_information: Represents everyday citizens in fantasy settings.
No special abilities beyond basic attacks.
Can communicate in a single language.
Commonly found in societies as peasants or tradespeople.
Ideal for role-playing or fleshing out backgrounds in campaigns.
test_queries: humble farmer character with no combat skills
weak character that can form a mob
low threat creature in combat scenarios
